item.title: Central limit theorem
item.description: What? Sampling points from a distribution and plotting the frequency of the sample mean approaches a normal distribution. We start with some crazy distribution that has got nothing to do with a normal distribution. Sample points from that distribution with some arbitrary sample size, following which we plot the sample mean (or sample sum) on a frequency table – repeat this lot of times (tending to infinity) we end up getting a normal distribution of sample means!
